Description: Small scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with plumed cartouche containing debased hieroglyphs; surface eroded (according to drawing published in Gardner 1888).
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published in Gardner 1888, pl. XVIII, no. 26. According to Petrie, it is the name of Psamtek which is written inside the plumed oval (Petrie 1889, pl. 62, no. 1972). It is close to Gorton's type XXXIII B, though this type depicts Menkheperra in a plumed cartouche. Without seeing the actual scarab, the identification of its specific type remains speculative. Gardner, E. A. 1888, Naukratis. Part II (Sixth Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London. Petrie, W.M.F. 1889, Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically, London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1889 / Historical scarabs: a series of drawings from the principal collections arranged chronologically (pl. 62, no. 1972)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.100) (phase 3)
